title: Add aliases to make layer names more consistent?
body_html:
In the new layers API the convolutional layers have short names (conv1d, conv3d, etc.) while the pooling layers have full names (max_pooling1d, average_pooling3d, etc.) which seems inconsistent. tf.contrib.layers had aliases. Could something like that be added in to the core layers too?

E.g.

max_pool1d = max_pooling1d
convolution1d = conv1d

and so on.

body:
In the new [layers API](https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/master/tensorflow/python/layers/layers.py) the convolutional layers have short names (conv1d, conv3d, etc.) while the pooling layers have full names (max_pooling1d, average_pooling3d, etc.) which seems inconsistent. tf.contrib.layers had aliases. Could something like that be added in to the core layers too?

E.g.
```
max_pool1d = max_pooling1d
convolution1d = conv1d
```
and so on.
